conclusion: The detector moves along the positive x-axis starting from origin O, its velocity is inversely proportional to displacement, at point A velocity is 4 m/s, at point B velocity is 2 m/s, distance from O to B is 2 m, need to find the time taken to move from A to B.
Set up the velocity-displacement relationship as v = k/x.
Find the proportionality constant k using point B: k = 4.
Determine position of point A using v = 4/x_A, resulting in x_A = 1 m.
Set up the equation for time as t = (1/4)âˆ«x dx with limits from x_A = 1 to x_B = 2.
The time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B is 0.375 seconds.
